info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 5:24PM EDT until June 16 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR WESTERN CAMERON AND EASTERN ELK COUNTIES... At 523 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Benezette, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Emergency management. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Hicks Run around 530 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Weedville and Kersey. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central and north central Pennsylvania. A tornado warning is also in effect for southeastern Elk County. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. This storm is producing widespread wind damage across much of Elk County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
